column5: Hi Folks,  I can get this princecraft for probably 1300.00 Do you think its worth it> I already have a motor and trailer just need the boat. It has a floor, live well, rod holders on either side. I dunno whatya think.
what is it's year, length, Beam and model number?  Looks ok from that pic... but hard to tell without detailed pics of the interior and the aforementioned.  G.

Its a 14 footer Princrafet 1990. Carpets in good condition no scrathes or dents on the hull I didnt get the beam size or the Model #. I have been watching this boat for a while and it hasn't been selling because it's a short shaft boat and you would need at least a 20 to get er going good and a short shaft 20 is hard to come by sometimes.  He told me 1500 but I think even if I walk in there with a 1000 cash and slap it on the table with my trailer hooked to my van he might take it. Its been there since summer.
heck slap 800 and he'll prolly consider it.
if you can manage 1000.00 - 1200.00  you're fine, the beam is probably 60" What kind of motor do you have.... we had one like it  a resorter model 14' it would go 'bout 18mph with a 1995 merc 20.
I'd say not a bad deal and looks like it's in good shape, low ball him though as you say it's not the season to be selling and he may be interested in moving it.  Good Luck
It looks like the Pro Series 142. I had one with a 20 HP Merc short shaft. It was a great boat. wish I still had it!
Ya he said 1500 but he also saidhe doesn't want to store it for the winter. Its been there for a while since the summer
Looks like a fine boat GNODDY....go for it!  What is your gut tellin you?
It is the 140 Pro. I would put a 15 on it because I have one how was yours with the 20 do you think that if it had a 15 it would still go alright

Yeah, gotta agree with $800. Nice looking boat even for more than 800 bucks but winter is here now. Low ball your offer. If he balks then wait him out for a short while. If he is insulted by your offer then except that and up it after being silent. Remember when negotiating, the first one to speak is the looser.  Your car and trailer parked at the curb and not wanting to keep it for the next 5 months will work in your favour, it may get him anxious to take an offer. Also as you said point out that it is for a short shaft motor and that may be difficult to come across.  Good luck and let us know the outcome.
